shortdesc.ph: Selects the audio route in communication volume mode.
Selects the audio route in communication volume mode.
Selects the audio route in communication volume mode.

section.p: This method is used to switch the audio route from a Bluetooth headset to the earpiece, wired headset, or speaker in communication volume mode ([MODE_IN_COMMUNICATION](https://developer.android.google.cn/reference/kotlin/android/media/AudioManager?hl=en#mode_in_communication)).

This method is used in communication volume mode ([MODE_IN_COMMUNICATION](https://developer.android.google.cn/reference/kotlin/android/media/AudioManager?hl=en#mode_in_communication)) to switch the audio route from a Bluetooth headset to the earpiece, wired headset, or speaker.

This method is used in communication volume mode ([MODE_IN_COMMUNICATION](https://developer.android.google.cn/reference/kotlin/android/media/AudioManager?hl=en#mode_in_communication)) to switch the audio route from a Bluetooth headset to the earpiece, wired headset, or speaker.
section.note: This method is for Android only. When used together with , it may cause conflicts. Agora recommends using alone.
This method is applicable only on Android. Using this method together with may cause conflicts. Agora recommends using alone.
This method is for Android only. Using this method together with may cause conflicts. Agora recommends using alone.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Can be called before or after joining a channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel.
You can call this method before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback to report the current audio route.
After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback to report the current audio route.
After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback to report the current audio route.

plentry.pd:
The desired audio route:
-1: The system default audio route.
0: Headset with microphone.
1: Earpiece.
2: Headset without microphone.
3: Built-in speaker.
4: (Not supported) External speaker.
5: Bluetooth headset.
6: USB device.

4: (Not supported) External speaker.
5: Bluetooth headset.
6: USB device.
